intro: Jamesianthus, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America, particularly in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plants typically have basal leaves that are succulent and often covered in fine hairs, adapted to conserve water. They produce small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and early summer. Jamesianthus species are often used in xeriscaping due to their drought tolerance and ornamental value.
